definition: righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
indignant/anger/resentment
to fill or stuff/(of a form etc) to fill in
breast/receive

sentences.english: My heart often burned with indignation I knew not how to express.
sentences.chinese: 我经常感到义愤填膺，我真不知道如何表达。

sentences.english: He walked to the door and opened it, prepared to accost an intruder with righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他走上前去开门，义愤填膺地想向闯入者发难。
许多人都义愤填膺，溢于言表。

sentences.english: She waxes righteously indignant if anyone tries to contradict her.
sentences.chinese: 反驳她，她说起话来就会义愤填膺。

sentences.english: A phrase such as that will get some managers spluttering with indignation.
sentences.chinese: 这样一种说法会让一些经理感到义愤填膺。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama was dismissive when he should have been outraged.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马对此嗤之以鼻，他本应该义愤填膺。

sentences.english: I know that engagement with repressive regimes lacks the satisfying purity of indignation.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，与压制性政权接触没有义愤填膺来得畅快。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, there were instances of what Troyer describes as "moral outrage".
sentences.chinese: 然而，也有特耶叙述的“义愤填膺”的例子。

sentences.english: People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians.
sentences.chinese: 对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。

sentences.english: I am a little shy of any assumption of moral indignation.
sentences.chinese: 我不太愿意摆出一副义愤填膺的架势来。

sentences.english: Somebody be filled with righteous indignation.
I am utterly outraged and in disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 我相信我是有点义愤填膺了。

sentences.english: They were filled with righteous indignation.

definition: to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to resent/resentment
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to stir up emotions/furious/angry/anger
righteous indignation/moral indignation
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
bitter and hateful (idiom)/to grieve and lament (over sth)
indignant/furious
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to denounce/to condemn
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
